name: dart_libp2p_kad_dht
desc: A Dart implementation of the libp2p Kademlia DHT.

name: AminoConstants
desc: Protocol constants for the Amino DHT

name: defaultBucketSize
desc:
DefaultBucketSize is the Amino DHT bucket size (k in the Kademlia paper).
It represents the maximum number of peers stored in each
k-bucket of the routing table.

name: defaultConcurrency
desc:
DefaultConcurrency is the suggested number of concurrent requests (alpha
in the Kademlia paper) for a given query path in Amino DHT. It
determines how many parallel lookups are performed during network
traversal.

name: defaultLookupCheckConcurrency
desc:
DefaultLookupCheckConcurrency is the maximal number of routines that can be used
to perform a lookup check operation, before adding a new node to the routing table.

name: defaultMaxLatency
desc:
DefaultMaxLatency is the maximum acceptable latency for peers in the routing table.
Peers with higher latency will not be added to the routing table.

name: defaultMaxPeersPerIPGroup
desc:
DefaultMaxPeersPerIPGroup is the maximal number of peers with addresses in
the same IP group allowed in the routing table. Once this limit is
reached, newly discovered peers with addresses in the same IP group will
not be added to the routing table.

name: defaultMaxPeersPerIPGroupPerCpl
desc:
DefaultMaxPeersPerIPGroupPerCpl is maximal number of peers with addresses
in the same IP group allowed in each routing table bucket, defined by its
common prefix length to self peer id.
also see: DefaultMaxPeersPerIPGroup.

name: defaultOptimisticProvideJobsPoolSize
desc:
DefaultOptimisticProvideJobsPoolSize is the asynchronicity limit for in-flight
ADD_PROVIDER RPCs. It's set to a multiple of OptProvReturnRatio * BucketSize.

name: defaultProvideValidity
desc:
DefaultProvideValidity is the default time that a Provider Record should
last on Amino DHT before it needs to be refreshed or removed. This value
is also known as Provider Record Expiration Interval.

name: defaultProviderAddrTTL
desc:
DefaultProviderAddrTTL is the TTL to keep the multi addresses of
provider peers around. Those addresses are returned alongside provider.
After it expires, the returned records will require an extra lookup, to
find the multiaddress associated with the returned peer id.

name: defaultRecordTTL
desc:
DefaultRecordTTL is the maximum time that any node will hold onto a record
from the time it's received. This is the same as DefaultProvideValidity.

name: defaultRefreshQueryTimeout
desc: DefaultRefreshQueryTimeout is the timeout for routing table refresh queries.

name: defaultResiliency
desc:
DefaultResiliency is the suggested number of peers closest to a target
that must have responded in order for a given query path to complete in
Amino DHT. This helps ensure reliable results by requiring multiple
confirmations.

name: defaultUsefulnessGracePeriod
desc:
DefaultUsefulnessGracePeriod is the period after which a peer is considered
not useful if it hasn't been useful during this time.

name: protocolID
desc: ProtocolID is the latest protocol identifier for the Amino DHT.

name: protocolPrefix
desc: ProtocolPrefix is the base prefix for Amino DHT protocols.

name: serverModeMinPeers
desc:
ServerModeMinPeers is the minimum number of peers required in the routing table
for the DHT to switch to server mode when in auto mode.

name: ConnectionType
desc: Enum for different types of peer connections

name: fromValue
desc: Get a ConnectionType from its numeric value

name: value
desc: The numeric value of this connection type

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: DHT
desc: DHT builder class that provides functional configuration similar to libp2p host configuration

name: new_
desc: Creates a new DHT instance with functional configuration options

name: DHTBootstrap
desc: Extension methods for DHT bootstrap functionality

name: bootstrap
desc:
Bootstrap tells the DHT to get into a bootstrapped state satisfying the
Routing interface.

name: fixRTIfNeeded
desc: Fixes the routing table if needed

name: forceRefresh
desc:
ForceRefresh acts like RefreshRoutingTable but forces the DHT to refresh all
buckets in the Routing Table irrespective of when they were last refreshed.

name: refreshRoutingTable
desc: RefreshRoutingTable tells the DHT to refresh its routing tables.

name: refreshRoutingTableNoWait
desc: Refreshes the routing table without waiting for completion

name: DHTConfig
desc: Configuration for the DHT

name: DHTConfig.new
desc: Creates a new DHT configuration with default values

name: addressFilter
desc: The filter for addresses

name: bootstrapPeers
desc: Function to get bootstrap peers

name: bucketSize
desc: The bucket size for the routing table

name: concurrency
desc: The concurrency level for queries

name: datastore
desc: The datastore for the DHT

name: dhtMessageRetryBackoffFactor
desc: The backoff factor for retrying a DHT message.

name: dhtMessageRetryInitialBackoff
desc: The initial backoff delay for retrying a DHT message.

name: dhtMessageRetryMaxBackoff
desc: The maximum backoff delay for retrying a DHT message.

name: disableFixLowPeers
desc: Whether to disable fixing low peers (for tests only)

name: enableOptimisticProvide
desc: Whether to enable optimistic provide

name: enableProviders
desc: Whether to enable providers

name: enableValues
desc: Whether to enable values

name: filterLocalhostInResponses
desc: Whether to filter localhost addresses from FIND_NODE responses

name: lookupCheckConcurrency
desc: The lookup check concurrency

name: maxDhtMessageRetryAttempts
desc: The maximum number of retry attempts for a DHT message.

name: maxPeersPerBucket
desc: Maximum number of peers per k-bucket (for bootstrap server capacity)

name: maxRecordAge
desc: The maximum age for records

name: maxRoutingTableSize
desc: Maximum size of the routing table (total peers across all buckets)

name: mode
desc: The mode of operation for the DHT

name: msgSenderBuilder
desc: The builder for message senders

name: onRequestHook
desc: Hook for incoming requests

name: optimisticProvideJobsPoolSize
desc: The pool size for optimistic provide jobs

name: protocolPrefix
desc: The protocol prefix for the DHT

name: providerStore
desc: The provider store for the DHT

name: queryPeerFilter
desc: The filter for peers to query

name: resiliency
desc: The resiliency level for queries

name: routingTableAutoRefresh
desc: Whether to automatically refresh the routing table

name: routingTableDiversityFilter
desc: The diversity filter for the routing table

name: routingTableLatencyTolerance
desc: The maximum acceptable latency for peers in the routing table

name: routingTablePeerFilter
desc: The filter for peers in the routing table

name: routingTableRefreshInterval
desc: The refresh interval for the routing table

name: routingTableRefreshQueryTimeout
desc: The timeout for routing table refresh queries

name: testAddressUpdateProcessing
desc: Whether to force address update processing (for tests only)

name: v1ProtocolOverride
desc: Override for the v1 protocol

name: validator
desc: The validator for records

name: validatorChanged
desc: Whether the validator has been changed from the default

ProviderManager adds and retrieves providers from a datastore,

name: getProviderTime

name: isEmpty

name: ProviderStore

name: addProvider
desc: Adds a provider for the given key

name: close

name: QueryEvent
desc: Base class for all events emitted during a query operation.

name: QueryFilterFunc
desc: Type definition for a function that filters peers for queries

name: QueryFunction
desc: A function that queries a peer and returns a list of closer peers.

name: QueryPeerset
desc:
QueryPeerset maintains the state of a Kademlia asynchronous lookup.
The lookup state is a set of peers, each labeled with a peer state.

name: QueryPeerset.new
desc:
Creates a new empty set of peers.
key is the target key of the lookup that this peer set is for.

name: getClosestInStates
desc:
Gets all peers that are in one of the given states.
The returned peers are sorted in ascending order by their distance to the key.

name: getClosestNInStates
desc:
Gets the closest n peers to the key that are in one of the given states.
Returns fewer peers if fewer peers meet the condition.
The returned peers are sorted in ascending order by their distance to the key.

name: getReferrer
desc:
Gets the peer that referred us to the peer p.
Throws if p is not in the peerset.

name: getState
desc:
Gets the state of peer p.
Throws if p is not in the peerset.

name: key
desc: The key being searched for

name: numHeard
desc: Returns the number of peers in state PeerState.heard.

name: numWaiting
desc: Returns the number of peers in state PeerState.waiting.

name: setState
desc:
Sets the state of peer p to s.
Throws if p is not in the peerset.

name: tryAdd
desc:
Tries to add the peer p to the peer set.
If the peer is already present, no action is taken.
Otherwise, the peer is added with state set to PeerState.heard.
Returns true if the peer was not already present.

name: QueryResult
desc: Represents the result of a completed query operation.

name: errors
desc: List of exceptions that occurred during peer queries.

name: peerset
desc: The set of peers discovered and queried during the lookup.

name: reason
desc: The reason why the query terminated.

name: QueryRunner
desc: A robust, event-driven query runner for Kademlia DHT lookups.

name: QueryRunner.new
desc: Creates a new QueryRunner for performing Kademlia DHT lookups.

name: cancel
desc: Cancels the currently running query.

name: dispose
desc: Disposes of the QueryRunner and releases all resources.

name: events
desc: Stream of events emitted during query execution.

name: isCancelled
desc: Whether the query has been cancelled.

name: isRunning
desc: Whether the query is currently executing.

name: run
desc: Executes the query and returns the result.

name: QueryTerminated
desc: Event emitted when the query terminates.

name: result
desc: The final result of the query operation.

name: QueryTerminationReason
desc: Enumeration of possible query termination reasons.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: Record
desc:
Record represents a DHT record that contains a value
for a key. It contains a timestamp and public key that
is used to verify the record.

name: Record.fromJson
desc: Creates a Record from a map

name: Record.new
desc: Creates a new Record

name: author
desc: Public key that created this record

name: key
desc: The key that references this record

name: props
desc:
The list of properties that will be used to determine whether
two instances are equal.

name: signature
desc: A signature of the key and value

name: timeReceived
desc: Time the record was created (milliseconds since epoch)

name: toJson
desc: Converts this Record to a map

name: toString
desc: A string representation of this object.

name: value
desc: The actual value this record is storing

name: RouteTableFilterFunc
desc: Type definition for a function that filters peers for the routing table

name: RouterCache
desc: Router cache

name: getCachedRouter
desc: Gets the cached router, refreshing if needed

name: SimplePeerLatencyMetrics
desc:
Simple implementation of PeerLatencyMetrics that returns a default latency
for all peers. In a real implementation, this would use the host's peerstore
to get actual latency measurements.

name: SimplePeerLatencyMetrics.new
desc: Creates a new SimplePeerLatencyMetrics with the given default latency

name: defaultLatency
desc: Default latency to return for all peers

name: latencyEWMA
desc: Returns the exponentially weighted moving average latency for a peer

name: SimpleProtocolMessenger
desc: Simple concrete implementation of ProtocolMessenger for DHT v2

name: getValue
desc: Gets a value from a peer.

name: StopFunction
desc: A function that determines when a query should stop.

name: addressFilter
desc:
AddressFilter allows to configure the address filtering function.
This function is run before addresses are added to the peerstore.
It is most useful to avoid adding localhost / local addresses.

name: bootstrapPeers
desc:
BootstrapPeers configures the bootstrapping nodes that we will connect to to seed
and refresh our Routing Table if it becomes empty.

name: bootstrapPeersFunc
desc:
BootstrapPeersFunc configures the function that returns the bootstrapping nodes that we will
connect to to seed and refresh our Routing Table if it becomes empty.

name: bucketSize
desc: BucketSize configures the bucket size (k in the Kademlia paper) of the routing table.

name: concurrency
desc: Concurrency configures the number of concurrent requests (alpha in the Kademlia paper) for a given query path.

name: datastore
desc: Datastore configures the DHT to use the specified datastore.

name: defaultBootstrapPeers
desc: DefaultBootstrapPeers is a set of public DHT bootstrap peers provided by libp2p.

name: dhtMessageRetryBackoffFactor
desc: DhtMessageRetryBackoffFactor configures the multiplicative factor for DHT message retry backoff.

name: dhtMessageRetryInitialBackoff
desc: DhtMessageRetryInitialBackoff configures the initial delay before retrying a DHT message.

name: dhtMessageRetryMaxBackoff
desc: DhtMessageRetryMaxBackoff configures the maximum delay between DHT message retries.

name: disableAutoRefresh
desc:
DisableAutoRefresh completely disables 'auto-refresh' on the DHT routing
table. This means that we will neither refresh the routing table periodically
nor when the routing table size goes below the minimum threshold.

name: disableProviders
desc: DisableProviders disables storing and retrieving provider records.

name: disableValues
desc:
DisableValues disables storing and retrieving value records (including
public keys).

name: enableOptimisticProvide
desc:
EnableOptimisticProvide enables an optimization that skips the last hops of the provide process.
This works by using the network size estimator (which uses the keyspace density of queries)
to optimistically send ADD_PROVIDER requests when we most likely have found the last hop.
It will also run some ADD_PROVIDER requests asynchronously in the background after returning,
this allows to optimistically return earlier if some threshold number of RPCs have succeeded.
The number of background/in-flight queries can be configured with the OptimisticProvideJobsPoolSize
option.

name: filterLocalhostAddrs
desc: Filters out localhost addresses from a list of multiaddrs

name: filterLocalhostInResponses
desc:
FilterLocalhostInResponses configures whether to filter localhost addresses from FIND_NODE responses.
This prevents advertising 127.0.0.1 addresses to remote peers, which are not useful for them.

name: getDefaultBootstrapPeerAddrInfos
desc:
GetDefaultBootstrapPeerAddrInfos returns the AddrInfo objects for the default
bootstrap peers so we can use these for initializing the DHT by passing these to the
bootstrapPeers(...) option.

name: hasValidConnectedness
desc: Checks if a peer has valid connectedness

name: inAddrRange
desc: Checks if an IP is in any of the given IP networks

name: isEUI
desc: Checks if an IPv6 address is an EUI-64 address

name: isLocalhostAddr
desc: Checks if a multiaddr contains a localhost/loopback address

name: isPrivateAddr
desc:
isPrivateAddr follows the logic of manet.IsPrivateAddr, except that
it uses a stricter definition of "public" for ipv6

name: isPublicAddr
desc:
isPublicAddr follows the logic of manet.IsPublicAddr, except it uses
a stricter definition of "public" for ipv6: namely "is it in 2000::/3"?

name: isRelayAddr
desc: Checks if a multiaddr is a relay address

name: lookupCheckConcurrency
desc:
LookupCheckConcurrency configures maximal number of go routines that can be used to
perform a lookup check operation, before adding a new node to the routing table.

name: maxDhtMessageRetries
desc: MaxDhtMessageRetries configures the maximum number of attempts for sending a DHT message.

name: maxNBootstrappers
desc: Maximum number of bootstrappers to use at once

name: maxPeersPerBucket
desc:
MaxPeersPerBucket configures the maximum number of peers per k-bucket.
This is particularly useful for controlling bootstrap server capacity.

name: maxRecordAge
desc:
MaxRecordAge specifies the maximum time that any node will hold onto a record ("PutValue record")
from the time its received. This does not apply to any other forms of validity that
the record may contain.
For example, a record may contain an ipns entry with an EOL saying its valid
until the year 2020 (a great time in the future). For that record to stick around
it must be rebroadcasted more frequently than once every 'MaxRecordAge'

name: maxRoutingTableSize
desc:
MaxRoutingTableSize configures the maximum size of the routing table.
This limits the total number of peers across all buckets, which is useful
for mobile devices with limited resources.

name: minRTRefreshThreshold
desc:
Minimum number of peers in the routing table. If we drop below this and we
see a new peer, we trigger a bootstrap round.

name: mode
desc: Mode configures which mode the DHT operates in (Client, Server, Auto).

name: namespacedValidator
desc:
NamespacedValidator adds a validator namespaced under ns. This option fails
if the DHT is not using a NamespacedValidator as its validator (it
uses one by default but this can be overridden with the Validator option).
Adding a namespaced validator without changing the Validator will result in
adding a new validator in addition to the default public key and IPNS validators.
The "pk" and "ipns" namespaces cannot be overridden here unless a new Validator
has been set first.

name: onRequestHook
desc:
OnRequestHook registers a callback function that will be invoked for every
incoming DHT protocol message.
Note: Ensure that the callback executes efficiently, as it will block the
entire message handler.

name: optimisticProvideJobsPoolSize
desc:
OptimisticProvideJobsPoolSize allows to configure the asynchronicity limit for in-flight ADD_PROVIDER RPCs.
It makes sense to set it to a multiple of optProvReturnRatio * BucketSize. Check the description of
EnableOptimisticProvide for more details.

name: periodicBootstrapInterval
desc: Interval for periodic bootstrap operations

name: privRTFilter
desc: Helper function for private routing table filter

name: private4
desc: Private IPv4 networks

name: privateQueryFilter
desc: PrivateQueryFilter doesn't currently restrict which peers we are willing to query from the local DHT.

name: privateRoutingTableFilter
desc:
PrivateRoutingTableFilter allows a peer to be added to the routing table if the connections to that peer indicate
that it is on a private network

name: protocolExtension
desc:
ProtocolExtension adds an application specific protocol to the DHT protocol. For example,
/ipfs/lan/kad/1.0.0 instead of /ipfs/kad/1.0.0. extension should be of the form /lan.

name: protocolPrefix
desc:
ProtocolPrefix sets an application specific prefix to be attached to all DHT protocols. For example,
/myapp/kad/1.0.0 instead of /ipfs/kad/1.0.0. Prefix should be of the form /myapp.

name: protocols
desc:
Protocols is a list containing all supported protocol IDs for Amino DHT.
Currently, it only includes the main ProtocolID, but it's defined as a list
to allow for potential future protocol versions or variants.

name: providerStore
desc: ProviderStore sets the provider storage manager.

name: public6
desc: Public IPv6 network

name: publicCIDR6
desc: CIDR for public IPv6 addresses

name: publicQueryFilter
desc: PublicQueryFilter returns true if the peer is suspected of being publicly accessible

name: publicRoutingTableFilter
desc:
PublicRoutingTableFilter allows a peer to be added to the routing table if the connections to that peer indicate
that it is on a public network

name: queryFilter
desc: QueryFilter sets a function that approves which peers may be dialed in a query

name: refreshInterval
desc:
RefreshInterval configures the refresh interval for the routing table.
This is a convenience function that sets the routingTableRefreshInterval.

name: resiliency
desc:
Resiliency configures the number of peers closest to a target that must have responded in order for a given query
path to complete.

name: routerCache
desc: Global router cache

name: routerCacheTime
desc: Cache duration for the router

name: routingTableFilter
desc:
RoutingTableFilter sets a function that approves which peers may be added to the routing table. The host should
already have at least one connection to the peer under consideration.

name: routingTableLatencyTolerance
desc:
RoutingTableLatencyTolerance sets the maximum acceptable latency for peers
in the routing table's cluster.

name: routingTablePeerDiversityFilter
desc: RoutingTablePeerDiversityFilter configures the implementation of the diversity filter for the Routing Table.

name: routingTableRefreshPeriod
desc:
RoutingTableRefreshPeriod sets the period for refreshing buckets in the
routing table. The DHT will refresh buckets every period by:

name: routingTableRefreshQueryTimeout
desc:
RoutingTableRefreshQueryTimeout sets the timeout for routing table refresh
queries.

name: sameV6Net
desc: Checks if two IPv6 addresses are in the same network

name: toIP
desc: Extracts the IP address from a multiaddr

name: unroutable4
desc: Unroutable IPv4 networks

name: unroutable6
desc: Unroutable IPv6 networks

name: v1ProtocolOverride
desc:
V1ProtocolOverride overrides the protocolID used for /kad/1.0.0 with another. This is an
advanced feature, and should only be used to handle legacy networks that have not been
using protocolIDs of the form /app/kad/1.0.0.

name: validator
desc: Validator configures the DHT to use the specified validator.

name: withCustomMessageSender
desc:
WithCustomMessageSender configures the MessageSender of the DHT to use the
custom implementation of the MessageSender
